title: Ideal gas law - pressure dependence on temperature

content.question: A sample of ideal gas is in a closed container of constant volume <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>V</mi></math>. The gas is initially at a temperature <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math> and pressure <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math>. The temperature of the gas is then doubled. Which of the following correctly describes the pressure in the gas after the temperature is doubled?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
